title: In sync
excerpt: One of the biggest objections many organizations have for  not  going full-time remote is the misconception that they’ll no longer be in sync.

children.text: One of the biggest objections many organizations have for
going full-time remote is the misconception that they’ll no longer be in sync.
That’s because they’ve confused proximity of people with persistent coordination.
Working at the same time in the same place is no guarantee that your team is in sync.
But persistent and anticipated check-ins—by way of meetings, memos, messages and updates—are a great way to keep everyone on the same page.
You can do that while working in different time zones and in different states.
